Reviews.Title: Small correction
Reviews.Author: Nhan Du
Reviews.Content: The quick description says this computer is an intel computer, but the processor is actually an AMD E-300. This is not a negative. I have an laptop running an AMD E-350 and the price/performance rato is amazing. Just wanted to let you know that you will not find an "intel inside" decal on this.

Reviews.Title: Whats not to like
Reviews.Author: Tai Pan
Reviews.Content: Nice surprise......all you need plus duel core.....fast for a 1.3ghz ...Very sharp picture.......Windows 7 home premium great value for the price.........

Reviews.Title: Good Budget Laptop
Reviews.Author: L. Dumas "Shopping in NY"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic sub-500 laptop that features a CPU marked at 1.3 Ghz but rated to 1.95 Ghz, and a very nice graphics card for the money.  The hard-drive is relatively small, but is sufficient for most office and school needs.  The 4.5 GB DDR3 RAM is nice also, good for multitasking.  the 15.6 inch screen is fantastic, and has great color depth and, being covered with glass, is easy to clean.  The full sized keyboard is nice, though some buttons are in un-orthodox positions, but they are easy to get accustomed to.  The island style keys help to avoid typos.  The battery life with display turned down is approximately 6 hours with light use, with heavy use (playing medieval 2 total war with volume all the way up, graphics settings all on max, and brightness all the way up) yielded a battery life of about 4 hours, which is phenomenal.  All that being said, the speakers are very sub-par, a trait I have noticed on several of my other Toshiba laptops, and it is recommended that you purchase external powered speakers.  Another minus is that they volume controls and brightness are controlled through some Toshiba program that displays a dark gray bar over things you are working on, and fails to properly initiate sometimes, forcing you to reboot or disable the software (this seems to be one of those flashy things laptop makers include for the "wow" factor, similar to HP's quick launch garbage). It comes loaded with a bunch of useless and near-useless bloatware from the manufacturer, like "Toshiba book place" which launches by default, and Norton internet security is on there, which is an awful choice, so I just deleted those things and disabled them in start-up through msconfig.  For those interested, it features a wireless card capable of packet injection, works great with Backtrack 5 live CD.  It comes with Windows 7 64bit edition, though it works flawlessly with Ubuntu, OpenSUSE, and FreeBSD (haven't tried Fedora, sorry). No complaints so far, except for the speakers.  Very professional product, great for students and business applications, though gamers will be disappointed, as this can not handle titles published within the past 3 years, but it will run older titles beautifully.  I would recommend it, especially to parents looking to buy their kids a good laptop for college.  Hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: Junk product, junk customer service.
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas 2011 and here it is July and it is already broken.  I am sticking with Sony from now on, never had any problems with their laptops and they are only a little bit more, but it was a gift so I didn't want to complain. You get what you pay for I guess, and that seems to follow over to customer service as well.  For a company that has been sued before for hinge problems ([...]), you would think they would be nicer to customers calling about them, but no.  Because it doesn't matter how short of a time you have had the laptop, it is apparently normal wear and tear.  So understand Toshiba only expects there laptops to last up to seven months before there are problems.  You have been warned.  Spend about $100 and get a better laptop.

Reviews.Title: Poor customer care
Reviews.Author: BavBob
Reviews.Content: In the 7 months I have owned this, I have gone through 4 hardrives. Toshiba refuses to acknowledge an issue with the motherboard and says hardrives are unpredictable. Customer care could care about the amount of time this has cost me and they actually charge you for shipping back to you even when they repair it under warranty. Toshiba is a classic company that has forgotten that the little guy got them to where they are. Based on my experience, I will not buy any Toshiba products because their attitude toward the consumer is horrid.

Reviews.Title: Worst purchase I ever made
Reviews.Author: iwhuff
Reviews.Content: I previously had a positive attitude about Toshiba, this purchase changed all that. The plastic is extremely cheap and have broken around the components. The computer itself is functional but the plastic casing has slowly broken piece by piece. Looking for another laptop but not a Toshiba!

Reviews.Title: Flip Hinge Broken after only a few months of use
Reviews.Author: PlatoFromTexas
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for around $400 thinking that it was great value for the money.I have been generally satisfied with the software element of this laptop.  But I must askwhat sort of engineers designed such a shoddy excuse for a consumer product.  I have takengreat care of the laptop and most of its life has been spent on a desk where I open and closethe cover.  After a few months i noticed a small screw lying at the bottom of the laptop (whichit turns out was a screw for the flip hinge), and a few weeks later the hinge is broken. Now thehinges on both sides of the laptop are broken and I have not even owned it for a year.  I amextremely dissapointed at how cheaply this piece of garbage has been made.  Of course we live ina plastic world, so buying a plastic computer does not make one wary that it will fall apart afternominal use.  This is an issue of a company trying to sell a cheap product by putting in the mostminimal possible effort to create the product.  I assume Toshiba engineers are not so stupid as tothink that a laptop hinge to support a screen will only require a miniscule screw that you are likelyto find in an eyeglass frame. At this price I would have been better off purchasing an Ipad or aMicrosoft Surface tablet! Toshiba really needs to rethink whom they are fooling by selling cheap products.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: jack
Reviews.Content: Had this for over a year now and no problems what so ever, Great buy for the wife she likes it alot.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: cate
Reviews.Content: I've had this for perhaps a year and it works very well. I have had no problems with it, which is what one has in mind. I'm no computer expert, so I'm just happy if it works. Which it does. Also was a good price I think.

Reviews.Title: Flip Hinge broke after 5 months of use
Reviews.Author: Ck
Reviews.Content: The Flip hinge will break after couple of hundred times of opening and closing the Flip (which is less than 1 year of use). The Hinge supporting the Flip only has 1 tiny screw on each end which can't handle the stress of the 15" flip. I bought it few months ago and the screw broke rendering the Laptop useless. Don't just take my word for granted. Go to Best Buy, lift any Satellite series Laptop, and look under it you will see a tini mini screw at each end to hold the Flip hinges together.When i called Toshiba they said that Mechanical fixtures ARE NOT COVERED under the limited Warranty so they Know there is a design issue with the Flip and prone to breakage which is why they won't cover it.

Reviews.Title: Started falling apart after 5 months
Reviews.Author: Amy Poretsky
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for my 2 sons last Christmas.  The hinges on both computers broke, maybe because the screws that hold it together keep falling out of the bottom.  Very disappointed! My sons also complain about the speed.  Tosiba wants me to send both in for repair but they don't promise to cover the problem and want to charge me to send them in.  I am afraid it may be cheaper to buy a new computer.  What a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: toshiba laptop
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: In the first month, it worked very good. But after one month the laptops softwareand charger all got problems. After I sent to Toshiba for repairing,it is workingnow, but still not so good.

Reviews.Title: Worst Computer ever
Reviews.Author: ericluis
Reviews.Content: Completely disappointed with the computer and more disappointed with the service provided by your Toshiba Direct Service center. The Computer broke in less than two weeks and was sent to your service center, It's been 10 days and after I email to find out the status I was told that the computer was not covered under any warranty and that it will cost me around 325.00 for the repair. That it was better for me to take the computer to a local Mom and Pop shop for repairs. With this experience I will never purchase another Toshiba product and also make sure I will tell everyone I know how bad and low quality this product is.

Reviews.Title: A Satisfied Unsatisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did the research on this laptop before ordering here on Amazon. The laptop (for some reason) was delayed a bit in arriving. That was not really an issue because it was not a gift for anyone nor was I really in a hurry for it.When it arrived I was a little disappointed in the feel of it. The quality of the laptop was not what I expected from Toshiba -- a name brand computer. My last laptop was a Dell. My computers at work are Dells, but the reviews on the Toshiba looked good (and the price was very good) so I ordered it. The quality of the materials was an issue here -- the feel of it flimsy -- the mouse pad did not even have a vertical and horizontal bar for scrolling with the fingertips as my Dell laptop has.I ordered a new laptop because my Dell is several years old and I wanted more RAM for faster loading and internet browsing. The difference in the quality of my Dell and this Toshiba product was major.But the reason I returned the Toshiba was the fact that I had a difficult time getting the wireless to connect to the internet -- both at work and at home. When I would finally get it connected, I would be fortunate to have 2-3 minutes before the connection was broken. A computer tech at work said that it might need drivers downloaded even though it was a brand new unit. But how can you download drivers if you can't stay connected to the internet long enough to do so?So I returned the product. And here is where the "satisfied" comes in! I rarely have to return a product because I do my homework before I buy, so returning something like a laptop wasn't something I was looking forward to.But I printed out the return labels from Amazon (really, really nice!), took the unit to my UPS store where they packaged it safety for me and returned the unit.Amazon absolutely shines here! I received a confirmation almost immediately of the return and my refund was deposited back to my bank account very quickly!I have been a customer of Amazon.com for many years. I order a lot of stuff from them and now can say that even when you get a "lemon" Amazon.com can help you make lemonade!!

Reviews.Title: OK for the price
Reviews.Author: BeckyL
Reviews.Content: I got this for my son. Only a few problems with it. It got here in OK condition and worked fine. But in installing Linux on it for a dual boot system for him there was an issue as my Linux copy was damaged. In trying to remove the Linux it messed up the hard drive. The recovery partition was not a complete version and the repair disk I had burned when I first got it did not work and was in a foreign language. Since no recovery disks were included and no full recovery partition on it i had to purchase a set of recovery disks from Toshiba and pay 30 bucks. So beware that if you buy another laptop from this person and you have to repair it that it does not have the full recovery options of the factory installed Windows 7. The problems are my own fault, but a user should be able to burn a full recovery disk set or have access to a full recovery partition in case of problems.

Reviews.Title: At least it looks like my old Toshiba
Reviews.Author: Robbin Myers
Reviews.Content: I would recommend a Toshiba computer to anyone. The one I ordered was refurbished and it runs really slow. It was my understanding it would be just like brand new. The case looks great and so on, But the performance was a little bit of a let down.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: bruce aseltine
Reviews.Content: My Wife asked me to get her this laptop for Christmas a couple of years ago. We found it at Best Buy for $279. Yes that is a very good deal! We have had no issues with it until now. The hard drive is starting to go out on it. Will I go out and spend $50 - $60 on a new hard drive ? Absolutely Yes. If it fails again, will I go out and get another laptop ? Absolutely Yes. Will it be a Toshiba ?  Probably not. I would say this is a good "starter laptop" which can be used for play and general home duties, spread sheets, word documents, watching videos, etc.. I would not purchase it for school or business. You need something more reliable. All in all a very good laptop for the low cost of $279 !!

Reviews.Title: C6550-S5300 hidge problem
Reviews.Author: cmw
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these at the same time just about a yr ago, one for each of my 2 girls and one for my husband, they all love the computers. I only give this product a 2 star as on all three the left hinge has given way, and they have to be extra careful to open the computer lid and I know it will be just a matter of time before the hindges give way and they will no longer be useable. I have been looking online to see how many others are having the same problem and that there maybe a recall out there somewhere. Other then this the computers have been great

Reviews.Title: Would order again!!
Reviews.Author: Brent R. Wong
Reviews.Content: Item received as indicated.  Also included original in-store purchase receipt.  Laptop was ordered as a gift and the recipient has been happy since.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Laptop
Reviews.Author: reviewer
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop as a Christmas present. I got it and played around on it for about 4hrs. The 4GB of RAM works well with the 1.3GHz processor. I only wish the processor had a greater speed to it, but oh well. The computer comes with Windows 7 pre-installed, and this being my first experience I've had with both Toshiba and Win7, they're not that bad. I've noticed TOshiba typically puts processors with lower speeds in them, and I used to make fun of that, but now, I won't, because there is no need for 2.8GHz in a machine that runs great already with a processor that has less power than a netbook. Amazing graphics. I can watch HD videos no problem now (unlike my other PC that was "capable" for HD). I love this PC, I love my mom for buying it for me, and I would strongly recommend it!! Happy holidays!

Reviews.Title: Awsome Laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Mariam
Reviews.Content: Toshiba always have a laptop that they offer as courtesy. a very nice laptop with all of the feature that are available for starting $500.00. A great product for the price

Reviews.Title: Never Buy Toshiba
Reviews.Author: S. Maher
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Toshiba Satellite laptop in November for my daughter's Christmas present.  One month into owning the laptop, the screen stopped working.  There was no damage to the screen, it just stopped working.  We purchased the identical unit for our other daughter - that one, the hard drive failed.  Lousy product - do not buy.  Toshiba is not cooperating on repair for screen problem claiming we damaged it.  Not true - lousy products, lousy service.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel E Series Dual Core E 300 Processor 1.6GHz
4GB DDR3 RAM
320GB Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen, Radeon HD
Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba Satellite C655d-5300
